text: The Mongolian Green Party () was founded in 1990 when Mongolia became a democracy, becoming the first Green party founded in Asia. From 1996 until 2000 the party was in the governing coalition with the Mongolian Social Democratic Party, Democratic Party, and the Mongolian Democratic Religion Party. The party has around 6,000 members and states its goal is working towards improving human rights and democracy in Mongolia and protecting the environment. Since 2012 Mongolian Green Party has a new leader: O. Boum- Yalagch. ==See also== *List of political parties in Mongolia ==References== ==External links== *Mongolian Green Party: official website *Mongolian Greens page at Global Greens Category:1990 establishments in Mongolia Category:Global Greens member parties Category:Green political parties Category:Political parties established in 1990 Category:Political parties in Mongolia
title: Mongolian Green Party
